body: WU gets new packages in 1-2 week. Please wait.

> WU gets new packages in 1-2 week. Please wait.

Thank you for the reply. I'll wait. Do you have any plans to add these words in the prompt for Powershell core to users who have WSUS enabled for Powershell? Just thinking for the sanity of internal IT Help Desks so they don't get pinged unnecessarily by corporate users who may not have admin access to update Powershell core themselves.

> Just thinking for the sanity of internal IT Help Desks so they don't get pinged unnecessarily by corporate users who may not have admin access to update Powershell core themselves. You can suppress the notification with env variable in enterprise scenario. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.core/about/about_update_notifications?view=powershell-7.2#long-description
about Update Notifications - PowerShell
Notifies users on startup of PowerShell that a new version of PowerShell has been released.
We have scheduled this for early next year.  This is the earliest date that we are allowed to release to Microsoft Update.
Why does it take so long. Isn't 7 2.1 due to a vulnerability?? So why wait?
Can this issue be reopened? It's been a month and still no update.
Ah, now eventually you do plan to have dinosaurs on your, on your dinosaur tour, right? Hello?

I have a hyper-v virtual machine that seems to have somehow gotten this update unless I manually updated and forgot about it. The only difference I can tell is the OS is 10.0.19043 instead of 10.0.19044 ## 10.0.19043
CLICK ME
